brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to investigate the proportion of HER2 overexpression in
      gastric cancer patients group, to evaluate the relation of HER2 overexpression with
      prognosis, and to analyze the proportion of herceptin applied to patients in clinical field.
      Furthermore, the investigators are going to reevaluate the clinical benefit of Herceptin for
      survival prolongation compared to chemotherapy only.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Proportion of Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 Protein Overexpression of Gastric Adenocarcinoma and Prognostic Effect of HER2, and Analysis of Practice Pattern of Herceptin Use in Stage IV Gastric Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Histologically confirmed gastric adenocarcinoma

          2. Patients were diagnosed during 2006-2013

          3. HER2 expression status was evaluated in primary gastric cancer or metastatic lesion.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with second primary cancer within 5 years

study_pop.textblock: gastric cancer patients in Gangnam Severance Hospital

other_outcome.measure: The practice pattern of Herceptin use in stage IV gastric cancer

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of HER2 overexpression in gastric cancer patients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Chief of division of medical oncology, Gangnam Severance Hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Gastric cancer specific survival according to HER2 expression in each stage

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
